bow: my wife the warrior my wife gave birth to our second child this morning we live in bedroom apartment in ontario canada in the middle of the night about 2:30 she felt some mild contractions after an hour she drew bath and started to time her contractions they were all over the place mins mins mins 5mins she thought she had plenty of time suddenly she felt like she was going to poop but soon realized the baby was on it way alone and in silence she delivered the baby herself in our bathtub after two quick pushes woke up seconds afterwards to her calling for me was confused and terrified to see an infant on her chest in the tub this was not our plan paged our midwives and called 911 as was instructed by them two ambulances showed up at the same time as our midwife they determined that mom and baby were perfectly fine and no hospital visit was needed the baby is now almost 20 hours old and doing fine am still in shock that my wife had an unassisted home birth she is the strongest person know and just wanted to share this story with some other dads also huge shout out to midwives everywhere they offer an amazing service in ontario and if it is available where you live you should definitely look into it wow please spoil her rotten the next few weeks even if she sounds badass and she did need anyone to get this baby out there is never enough assistance in the newborn stage congratulations congratulations does it hurt debating skipping the epidural for my second son and going natural terrified it ll hurt more than the contractions of my first baby which were like millions of knives slicing my body in half every 40 seconds until that sweet sweet epidural made me feel nothing this brought tears to my eyes what an amazing experience that must of been for her congrats on your new little bundle needed an epidural with my first but delivered my second baby unmedicated it was an entirely different experience it hurt but not for long and it was more than could handle that awesome can imagine your wife was just as shocked okay then can handle it could ve handled the contractions when they were minutes apart but not when they seconds apart if it doesn hurt that bad with my second then ll go without wow that is amazing congrats your wife has some real grit and love how much you appreciate her hope you and your family are doing amazing sending love to you in ontario from ontario lol what warrior congrats to you both sending the best vibes your way she is amazing being her second child can help but think that she may have thought can do this may just *accidentally* not make it to the hospital on time strong woman congratulations on your newest addition awesome birth story incredible way to go mama congratulations to all of you live in ontario too and used midwives best experience ever did you have pitocin natural contractions are much easier to handle my third birth was completely natural and the labor was easy pushing terrified me wasn exactly planning on going med free but the moment the baby came out all the pain was forgotten by far my easiest birth and recovery got the epidural both times and kind of regret doing it for my second because it was such an easy labor compared to my 48 hour labor with my first guess was expecting similar experience the second time ive done with epidural and without from my experience the births with epidurals dragged on much longer so remember the pain more than the one without with my first was determined do go without epidural but was induced and in labor for 24+hrs so broke got morphine drips then the epidural in hindsight the pain leading to getting the morphine was tolerable but was exhausted my long winded comment is to say try without and if you cant then request it just had my second and my epidural didn work didn feel the ring of fire or anything like that but the contractions near the end were unbearable wouldn want to do that again you don have to make the decision now plus the second might come too quickly for an epidural my second and third came fast the nurse showed me the contraction tape and only pushed for minute and half for one of them our first went all wacky my wife water broke before any contractions started we waited almost 12 hours before going in waiting for contractions to actually start they were there but nothing like what we expected we eventually decided to go in she was moving along but not as fast as they wanted and we got pressured into doing the pitocin that send things from mild to crazy real quick our daughter ended up coming down funny and getting her head stuck at weird angle after 29 hours it ended in cesarean we ll never know if it was going slow because she was stuck or if she got stuck because we tried to rush it but know we both regret getting pressured into the pitocin that amazing good for her oh am we re using formula flat inverted nipples so my wife has trouble latching so was on night feeding duty and letting her get good sleep thank you my wife did use an epidural with our first son either she said it was less painful this second time around being in warm bath really helped congrats and good luck thank you thank you thanks much appreciated lol thanks thank you amen they are life savers it also great that they come to the house after to weigh and do tests no need to drive back to the hospital to do tests thank you yes pitocin drip at 7:30 am and gave birth by 2:43 pm yeah with my first my back hurt so much for several months almost year actually was terrified into thinking must ve paralyzed myself or something don want to go through that again 33 weeks pregnant right now with my second due october and looking for an excuse to do it naturally wanted to go as long as could without it but the nurses were pushy guess because was getting closer to the point where it was too late to stick the needles in the pain during labor non existent the pain after oh god my back hurt everything was sore it took almost year for the epidural site to finally stop throbbing in pain hear you on the pain after with my last one the man missed guess because he had to redo at least times my lower back was black and blue for weeks after and know now when it will rain before everyone else would play it by ear tbh every birth is different did short stint as labour and delivery nurse and saw it all peaceful unmedicated births several days long agonizing natural births protracted epidural and pitocin labors labors that suddenly speed up after an epidural because mom was finally able to relax and the infamous no time for an epidural births the only right decision is what works for you and your baby in the moment good luck wonder if the hospital allows warm bath births was looking into birthing center but paranoid something will go wrong that midwives aren equipped to handle so leaning towards hospital birth again haha my mom has that power but she has arthritis on her knees yeah don miss the afterpain thought it was my fault because have scoliosis good to know it universal am just in awe of your wife strength and quick thinking congratulations on your new baby thank you for bringing this story to twox yea most women have spoken to regret the epidural good luck with hope you have safe and speedy delivery ps tell your mom to charge for rain predictions lol one of the hospitals in our city offers birthing tubs say call around and look into it thank you are you asking if birth hurts yes it does totally ok to use an epidural or not it your choice of course have friends who ve done it without pain killers—that whole ring of fire feeling is real thing as well as the possibility of tearing and needing stitches down there after birth wow amazing job glad both are doing well can imagine giving birth at home with no meds good for her that pretty much what happened with my first baby too except my water broke during an exam am convinced the ob broke it without my permission luckily found better provider who encouraged me to have vbacs and far better birth experiences we re hoping for successful vbac this time around know my wife felt really robbed with the last one since the cesarean was super urgent we had enough time for them to do an epidural the idea was this way she would be awake and could meet our daughter short version the epidural did work correctly and they did realize it until they already had her half way cut open was trying to tell them something was right but they did listen and just said well you ll feel some tugging and pressure finally the doc said something to the effect of you can feel that to which she replied yes the whole tone in the room changed at that moment they could get her any fast acting stuff until the baby was out either so they finished the cesarean with her feeling everything and then they gave her mix of stuff that knocked her out just typing that out still makes me feel some significant anxiety and it was over years ago now my second went so much faster than my first that but the time they were inserting the needle for the epidural and felt needed to push had my baby 10 minutes later check into seeing if their are any other types of birthing centers my area southern utah has birthing center that is set up to give you an at home birth but in the hospital they check you the same to make sure nothing has changed and your still low risk birth and them just do regular ultrasounds instead of the constant monitoring if anything happens or you change your mind your right there to be switched to regular hospital birth best thing that is selling me you get to go home after hours you just have to return for the required testing on baby doing this for baby number yes asking if second birth hurts ve gone through my first with epidural and leaning towards going natural with my second but didn know if it ll be as painful or easier holy sh*t was expecting some mushy mediocre story about how strong your wife is waking up to feed baby at night etc and was prepared to roll my eyes but damn lol yes that lady is crazy brave momma warrior pamper that lady get her her favorite foods and let her rest oh my word that horrifying birth trauma is very real and found didn deal with it until gave birth to my other kids like after having the baby you re so busy taking care of it you don examine the emotional scars of the delivery please please make sure you guys have truly supportive provider not just tolerant one both of my vbacs came past 41 weeks and both babies were perfectly healthy but know if been with different provider they never let me go past 40 weeks good luck wow wow what champ that amazing congratulations on your new baby 31 weeks with my 3rd baby and homebirth is actually my biggest fear love the hospital apparently but you and your wife just made me feel like if had to could totally do it how far along was she we are also in ontario third baby with the midwives and can sing their praises enough due date was august 19th so 39 weeks yup definitely little teary here women are pure magic just incredible every birth like every pregnancy is
